pullRequest.body:
Define `LocallyLipschitzOn`, the restricted version of `LocallyLipschitz`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
I just saw the branch [`MR_locally_lipschitz_on`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/MR_locally_lipschitz_on) by @grunweg after writing this PR.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b75be2d040](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13990/commits/b75be2d0409d5acaf8764d3b522c669228f1f913)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LocallyLipschitzOn`
`+ LocallyLipschitzOn.mono`
`+ LocallyLipschitzOn.restrict`
`+ Set.MapsTo.lipschitzOnWith_iff_restrict`
`+ continuousOn`
`+ lipschitzOnWith_restrict`
`+ lipschitzOnWith_univ`
`+ locallyLipschitzOn_empty`
`+ locallyLipschitzOn_iff_restrict`
`+ locallyLipschitzOn_univ`
`+ nhds_subtype_eq_comap_nhdsWithin`
`- MapsTo.lipschitzOnWith_iff_restrict`
`-++ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Sorry for the delay, my past weeks were really busy. I'll try to review this tomorrow - but if anybody else wants to chime in, this is also welcome!
PS. Would you like to PR further material from my old branch, or should I try to dust that off?
I think I've got most things there, but I'm not sure. I will try to dig stuff up if I have time but feel free to do so yourself and add commits to this PR. I have no time myself until next Tuesday.

I've now looked through your branch and I'm of the opinion that you should open a separate PR (depending on this one) for whatever I don't have here. The reason is that those lemmas I'm missing here depend on other lemmas which would be scope-creep for the current PR.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9983453302/job/27591070706)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9983453302/job/27591071188)

This basically looks good to me, let's have a maintainer take a look.
maintainer merge
Nicely done, my past self (very new to Lean) can certainly learn! I have three minor comments, then it's good to go.

This basically looks good to me, let's have a maintainer take a look.
maintainer merge

```suggestion
has a neighourhood within `s` on which `f` is Lipschitz. -/
Per the style guide, please use `|>` and `<|` instead of the $ operator. Thanks!
This is pre-existing, but: I'm not thrilled about the subtle difference between `LipschitzOnWith.to_restrict` and `lipschitzOnWith_restrict`. I don't see an obvious improvement, though.
I have one but it's out of scope here. Will probably do in a separate PR
That would be lovely; feel free to ask me for review!

Thanks for catching this oversight! Does this need a deprecation also?
(I'm sympathetic to saying "no, this lemma was not used".)
no, this lemma was not used :)
Remove `[PseudoEMetricSpace Î±] [PseudoEMetricSpace Î²]` as they are now available as variables?
Just flagging this for a maintainer checking: I'm not confident judging the simp normal forms here; please double-check.
I agree it shouldn't be a simp lemma: both sides have their pros and cons, and none is obviously simpler than the other one.

Sorry for the delay in the process: let's do
```suggestion
@[deprecated (since := "2024-07-17")] alias lipschitzOn_univ := lipschitzOnWith_univ
Could you mention this in the file-level docstring?

```suggestion
/-- `f : Î± â†’ Î²` is called **locally Lipschitz continuous** on `s` iff every point `x` of `s`
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Locally Lipschitz functions on a set
